Daming","username":"jdaming","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jdaming/{size}/137720_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-24T02:34:52.020Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eThis is true currently.  The romi could run either/both WPILibPi and PhotonVision onboard.  It could even connect a Limelight to it (the Pi has both USB and an ethernet port, the XRP has neither).  Warning that all of these deplete the batteries much faster (unless you have an additional battery back)!\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThere are some people looking into developing a camera that communicates to the XRP via the Qwiic port.  The Romi as it would run the vision processing onboard where as the XRP doesn’t have nearly enough “resources” to do so.  The camera would just communicate back target information and have the compute on board similar to a
